content.title: New Entrepreneur-cum-enterprise Development Scheme
content.department: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
content.details: The scheme 'New Entrepreneur-Cum-Enterprise Development Scheme (NEEDS)' was launched to assist educated youth to become first-generation entrepreneurs. It provides training, helps in preparing business plans, and facilitates loans with a capital subsidy of 25% of the project cost not exceeding ₹75 lakhs.
benefits: Subsidy assistance up to 25% of the project cost (maximum ₹75 Lakhs)
Interest subvention at the rate of 3%
Priority in allotment in Small Industries Development Corporation (SIDCO) industrial estates
Additional capital subsidy for SC/ST or differently-abled candidates
eligibility: Resident of Tamil Nadu for not less than 3 years
Age between 21 to 35 years (relaxation up to 45 years for special categories)
Minimum educational qualification of 12th std./diploma/ITI or vocational training
New projects sanctioned specifically under the NEEDS
Not a defaulter to any Commercial Bank/TIIC
Project cost should be above ₹10 lakh and below ₹5 crore
10% contribution for General category; 5% for Special category
exclusions: Any activity directly connected with agriculture
Manufacturing of Polythene carry bags of less than 40 microns

faqs.question: Who are the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: First Generation Individual Entrepreneur (Proprietorship) or Group of Entrepreneurs (Partnership).

faqs.question: What is the age limit to apply under NEEDS?
faqs.answer: The applicant must be between 21 - 35 years, with relaxation up to 45 years for special categories.

faqs.question: Is there any income ceiling to get assistance under NEEDS?
faqs.answer: No, there is no family income ceiling prescribed.

faqs.question: What is the maximum subsidy available under this scheme?
faqs.answer: 25% of the eligible components of the project cost subject to a maximum of ₹75 Lakhs.
